title: What are the differences between 1960, 1963 and the 1979 constitution? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not a great deal.  We’ll use 1960 as a baseline.  Between 1960 and 1963, one Amendment was ratified.  The 23rd Amendment made it possible for the citizens of the District of Columbia (Washington DC) to vote in Presidential elections. Between 1963 and 1979 (why 1979?), 4 Amendments were ratified. The 24th Amendment barred Poll Taxes The 25th Amendment dealt with Presidential Disability and Succession The 26th set the Voting Age to 18. That’s it.  All the changes to the US Constitution between the years 1960, 1963 and 1979.  Now maybe you can elaborate why those years are significant?

Constitution of Nigeria - Wikipedia has the histories. 1960 was imposed by the UK. 1963 proclaimed a republic. 1979 changed from the parliamentary system to an American-style presidential system electing the president, and at an attempt at federalism required parties have appeal in many geographic areas.
